item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, February 2, 2025 at 8:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Recent results show that LLMs struggle with compositional tasks (135 points | 102 comments)
2. Show HN: ESP32 RC Cars (32 points | 3 comments)
3. Apple is open sourcing Swift Build (551 points | 241 comments)
4. CDC orders mass retraction and revision of submitted research (371 points | 182 comments)
5. RLHF Book (192 points | 17 comments)
6. A Rust procedural language handler for PostgreSQL (24 points | 1 comment)
7. Pointers Are Complicated II, or: We need better language specs (2020) (80 points | 38 comments)
8. SQL or Death? Seminar Series – Spring 2025 (31 points | 22 comments)
9. A bookmarklet to kill sticky headers (2013) (141 points | 55 comments)
10. AstroForge selects target for "high risk, seat of the pants" asteroid mission (5 points | 1 comment)
11. Bzip3: A spiritual successor to BZip2 (244 points | 139 comments)
12. Python 3, Pygame, and Debian Bookworm on the Miyoo A30 (113 points | 18 comments)
13. Enhancing your MIDI devices with Perl (73 points | 9 comments)
14. String of recent killings linked to Bay Area 'Zizians' (443 points | 561 comments)
15. LMD: A new, less wasteful metal 3D printing technique (56 points | 15 comments)
16. Visualizing all books of the world in ISBN-Space (374 points | 76 comments)
17. Macrodata Refinement (356 points | 201 comments)
18. The origin and unexpected evolution of the word "mainframe" (80 points | 23 comments)
19. I'm Ready for You: On Balzac (3 points | discuss)
20. Archivists work to save disappearing data.gov datasets (501 points | 145 comments)
21. A mouseless tale: trying for a keyboard-driven desktop (71 points | 34 comments)
22. Engineered waterways helped Ancient Amazonians became master maize farmers (20 points | 2 comments)
23. Avoid ISP Routers (2024) (232 points | 134 comments)
24. YouTube audio quality – How good does it get? (2022) (105 points | 65 comments)
25. 'Obelisks', a new class of life living inside humans (55 points | 11 comments)
26. MindsDB (YC W20) Is Hiring an Office Manager in SF ( | hide)
27. New thermogalvanic tech paves way for more efficient fridges (84 points | 38 comments)
28. Ratzilla (121 points | 25 comments)
29. Discovery of collagen in fossil bone could unlock new insights into dinosaurs (54 points | 13 comments)
30. OpenAI O3-Mini (914 points | 861 comments)
